item.title: Gsoc Snippet 13 06 2014 And 04 06 2014
item.description:
--- title: "[GSoC Snippet] 13/06/2014 and 04/06/2014" kind: article created_at: 2014-06-14 18:15:00 UTC author: Maciej (Developer Website) image: https://avatars1.githubusercontent.com/u/2752578?s=50 categories: GSoC-2014 tags: "news developers-page ruby jekyll" layout: post ---[code] added new routes for categories, tag page and feeds
[code] added tag, category pages + opml feeds
[maintenance] Created monitoring on Monitis.com, works great. I am considering adding agent to our generate.timvideos.us server to monitor our generation process.
[code] added reading categories from planet blogs RSS feed (from <category> node)
[code] css improvements on mobile devices


Originally posted on pino IT / ruby / developer

item.title: 14 June 14 Previous Post Was Wrongly Dated It Sho
item.description:
--- title: "14 June '14 (Previous post was wrongly dated, it should be 13)" kind: article created_at: 2014-06-14 17:41:36 UTC author: Niharika (Bug reporting system) image: https://avatars1.githubusercontent.com/u/5735280?s=50 categories: GSoC-2014 tags: "news bug-reporting-system python django" layout: post ---
  • Looked up the Admin functionality already provided by Django and if it could possibly be modified for our purpose. Turns out it would be better to make an Admin end from scratch.
  • Read about django-braces and gitignore.
Originally posted on Niharika Kohli

item.title: Gsoc Daily Log Preparing For Next Major Milestone
item.description:
--- title: "[GSoC Daily Log]: Preparing for next major milestone" kind: article created_at: 2014-06-13 18:00:00 UTC author: Rohit (VGA Extension) image: https://avatars1.githubusercontent.com/u/1108318?s=50 categories: GSoC-2014-HDMI2USB tags: "news hdmi2usb vgadaily-log google-summer-of-code" layout: post ---
Friday, 13th June 2014:

  • Started writing capture code
  • Looked on some DVI/HDMI codes to see if they can be used for displaying captured data
Originally posted on Dreams eXtrinsic

item.title: Daily Snippet
item.description:
--- title: "Daily snippet" kind: article created_at: 2014-06-13 10:25:00 UTC author: Ayush (PTZ/Serial Extension) image: https://avatars0.githubusercontent.com/u/4787914?s=50 categories: GSoC-2014-HDMI2USB tags: "news hdmi2usb ptz serial-extension" layout: post ---
- It turns out that Sony PTZ cameras need DTR/DSR flow control and Canon PTZ cameras need RTS/CTS flow control.
- There must be ports on the serial expansion board with hardware flow control enabled.
- So these ports would require additional INT IN endpoint apart from BULK IN/OUT.
- Also each of these would require 6 FPGA pins from VHDCI.
- So there is an open question - how about having just 2 or 4 of these flow-controlled ports? And rest of them without flow control?
- A majority of serial devices work without flow control, and even these PTZ cameras may work without flow control at very low baud rate. But I don't have PTZ cameras to test so I wouldn't want to take chances.
- And there is another question left for us. Do CDC ACM drivers support Bulk only CDC ACM serial port, i.e. the ones without INT IN endpoint?
- Flow control is also a concern with the Numato board design, because that also seems to ignore RTS/CTS and DTR/DSR flow control. Only RX, TX is used in the schematics that I was shown. While this would work with RS422 pretty well, it might not work with RS232C based cameras.
Originally posted on Serial port expansion for HDMI2USB with PTZ camera control example
